## type [Model](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L14-L16>)

A Model is a simpleinput editor for handling simpleinput token\-based inputs without any special parsing required.

```go
type Model[T any] struct {
    // contains filtered or unexported fields
}
```

### func [New](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L19>)

```go
func New[T any](options ...Option[T]) *Model[T]
```

New creates new a model.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [AllTokens](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L83>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) AllTokens() []input.Token
```

AllTokens returns the tokenized input. This does include delimiter tokens.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [AllTokensBeforeCursor](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L95>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) AllTokensBeforeCursor() []input.Token
```

AllTokensBeforeCursor returns the tokenized input up to the cursor position. This does not include delimiter tokens.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Blur](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L148>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Blur()
```

Blur removes the focus from the input.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CurrentToken](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L60>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CurrentToken() input.Token
```

CurrentToken returns the token under the cursor.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CurrentTokenBeforeCursor](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L66>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CurrentTokenBeforeCursor() string
```

CurrentTokenBeforeCursor returns the portion of the token under the cursor that comes before the cursor position.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CursorIndex](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L161>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CursorIndex() int
```

CursorIndex returns the cursor index in terms of number of unicode characters. Use this to calculate input lengths in terms of number of characters entered.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [CursorOffset](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L155>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) CursorOffset() int
```

CursorOffset returns the visual offset of the cursor in terms of number of terminal cells. Use this for calculating visual dimensions such as input width/height.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Focus](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L116>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Focus() tea.Cmd
```

Focus sets the keyboard focus on the editor so the user can enter text.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Focused](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L121>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Focused() bool
```

Focused returns whether the keyboard is focused on the input.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Init](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L187>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Init() tea.Cmd
```

Init is part of the Input interface. It should not be invoked by end users.


### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Prompt](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L176>)


Prompt returns the terminal prompt.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [ResetValue](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L138>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) ResetValue()
```

ResetValue clears the input.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [Runes](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L133>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) Runes() []rune
```

Runes returns the raw text entered by the user as a list of runes. This is useful for indexing and length checks because doing these operations on strings does not work well with some unicode characters.

### func \(\*Model\[T\]\) [SetCursor](<https://github.com/aschey/bubbleprompt/blob/main/input/simpleinput/model.go#L166>)

```go
func (m *Model[T]) SetCursor(cursor int)
```

Set cursor sets the cursor position.

```go
func (m *Model[T]) SetCursorMode(cursorMode textinput.CursorMode) tea.Cmd
```

SetCursorMode sets the mode of the cursor.

```go
func (m *Model[T]) SetPrompt(prompt string)
```

SetPrompt sets the terminal prompt.

```go
func (m *Model[T]) SetValue(value string)
```

SetValue sets the text of the input.
